docs.snippet: The American Film Institute has decided to withdraw a movie that the institute's director said was "an inappropriate choice" for the opening of a new film theater at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.
docs.lead_paragraph: The American Film Institute has decided to withdraw a movie that the institute's director said was "an inappropriate choice" for the opening of a new film theater at the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.
docs.abstract: State of Siege, film based on assassination in Uruguay of Amer police expert D Mitrione by Tupamaro guerrillas, withdrawn from scheduled showing at opening of J F Kennedy Center for Performing Arts

byline.original: Special to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Like North Americans hurt by runaway meat prices, growing numbers of' South Americans are facing slimmer beef diets and beefless days.
docs.lead_paragraph: Like North Americans hurt by runaway meat prices, growing numbers of' South Americans are facing slimmer beef diets and beefless days.
docs.abstract: Soaring meat prices in S Amer spur many Govts to ban periodically beef sales; purpose of curtailing sales in some countries is to provide more meat for export, while other countries short on meat are restricting sales to cut down on imports and save currencies; officials say restrictions are effective in helping improve balance-of-payments situation; sales restrictions described in certain countries

headline.main: SOUTH AMERICANS EATING LESS BEEF; Refrigeration Is Crucial Official Trade Policies as Well as Prices Are Factors

docs.snippet: The worst may be yet to come in the latest Davis Cup crisis over South Africa. Even if Argentina agrees to play South Africa in their third-round match of the South American Zone, only the elimination of South Africa through defeat or default will...
docs.lead_paragraph: The worst may be yet to come in the latest Davis Cup crisis over South Africa. Even if Argentina agrees to play South Africa in their third-round match of the South American Zone, only the elimination of South Africa through defeat or default will avoid further political chaos in the competition this year.
docs.abstract: N Amdur speculates that Davis Cup tennis competition may be in for trouble if S Africa advances in S Amer Zone; sees many nations refusing to play S Africa because of its apartheid policy

headline.main: More Trouble Likely in Cup Tennis

docs.snippet: The black-tie opening of the Kennedy Center's first movie house was marred here today by confusion, controversy and charges of censorship. Hours before the American Film Institute was to open the doors of its $250,000, 224-seat theater to
docs.lead_paragraph: The black-tie opening of the Kennedy Center's first movie house was marred here today by confusion, controversy and charges of censorship. Hours before the American Film Institute was to open the doors of its $250,000, 224-seat theater to
docs.abstract: D Rugoff, head of Cinema 5 film distributing co, announces on Apr 3 that nearly 1/3 of films scheduled for Kennedy Center's Amer Film Inst inaugural festival will be withdrawn to protest inst dir G Stevens Jr decision not to open festival with showing of C Costa-Gavras film State of Siege; repts that other films that will be withheld from inst include R Rossellini film The Age of the Medicis, E Emshwiller films Relativity and Choice Chance Woman Dance, F Truffaut film Such a Gorgeous Kid Like Me, K Mizoguchi film Princess Yang Kwei Fei, J Chapot-R Hanrion film The Lumiere Years, L Anderson film O Lucky Man, Films From Henry Street, Sambizanga, and film program New Women, New Films; Stevens comments; illus from State of Siege

headline.main: Capital Film Festival Opens to Dispute; Called a Protest

docs.snippet: The United States called today for an end to the long-standing chill in relations with Albania as part of a more vigorous American effort to improve ties with all the Communist governments of Eastern Europe.
docs.lead_paragraph: The United States called today for an end to the long-standing chill in relations with Albania as part of a more vigorous American effort to improve ties with all the Communist governments of Eastern Europe.
docs.abstract: US Deputy Sec of State K Rush calls on Apr 4 for end to long-standing chill in relations with Albania as part of more vigorous Amer effort to improve tics with all Communist govts of Eastern Eur

headline.main: U.S. Would Discuss Amity With Albania;  Rhetoric of an Earlier Era'

docs.snippet: The State of New York has declared war against the monk parakeet, a flamboyant invader from South America that is threatening farmers' crops and suburban gardens as well as driving native birds from their nests.
docs.lead_paragraph: The State of New York has declared war against the monk parakeet, a flamboyant invader from South America that is threatening farmers' crops and suburban gardens as well as driving native birds from their nests.
docs.abstract: NYS Environmental Conservation Dept and NYS office of US Fish and Wildlife Service have devised several methods for eliminating monk parakeet from NY; bird is threatening agr crops in state; depts have decided to halt importation of bird, seek new state laws prohibiting sale of bird and to 'eradicate' wild monk parakeets populations in NJ, Conn and NY; announcement of decision to 'eliminate' monk parakeet population has not been made public because of anticipated outcry that state officials will receive from bird lovers; Natl Audubon Soc says orgn will not openly oppose campaign against bird but will not endorse it either; R C Boardman, dir of soc's public information, says there are conflicting repts about damage monk parakeet might do; says orgn strongly urges that program to eliminate birds be as humane as possible; monk parakeet population is estimated to be in thousands; bird described; illus

headline.main: State Acts to Wipe Out Monk Parakeet; State Moves Against Monk Parakeet

docs.snippet: Argentina will play its South American Zone Davis Cup semifinal series against South Africa in Uruguay this weekend, a spokesman at the Argentine Tennis Association disclosed today.
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentina will play its South American Zone Davis Cup semifinal series against South Africa in Uruguay this weekend, a spokesman at the Argentine Tennis Association disclosed today.
docs.abstract: Argentine Tennis Fed announces on Apr 9 that Argentina will play its S Amer Zone Davis Cup semi-final series against S Africa in Uruguay; move seen as diminishing opposition to matches from Argentine Govt over S African's apartheid policy

headline.main: ARGENTINA SHIFTS TENNIS MATCHES; Cup Series With So. Africa to Be Played in Montevideo ARGENTINA SHIFTS TENNIS MATCHES
